channel.title: Comments on: Report Builder 3.0 – Chart Wizard
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Bart Czernicki
item.dc:creator: Bart Czernicki
item.description: Even though I agree 3D pie visuals are evil (Stephen Few's books are awesome BTW), but I hate that in a blog post that is meant to be functional people are highlighting this.
item.content:encoded: Even though I agree 3D pie visuals are evil (Stephen Few’s books are awesome BTW), but I hate that in a blog post that is meant to be functional people are highlighting this.

item.title: By: SQLArcher
item.dc:creator: SQLArcher
item.description: And then all of them decide to get some good pie at the closest bakery :D
item.content:encoded: And then all of them decide to get some good pie at the closest bakery ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: Now I know why it takes BI people so long to get anything done. They spend way too much time deciding if they should use a pie chart or a bar chart ;-)
item.content:encoded: Now I know why it takes BI people so long to get anything done. They spend way too much time deciding if they should use a pie chart or a bar chart ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: @Jon - Ahhh, you want to debate the use of a pie chart. Thank you for the insight. As I mentioned in the blog, this is a very, very basic example of something that could be done in a report. This blog has nothing to do with the theory of which visualizations work best for which situations. It's to show people how to use Report Builder 3.0.
item.content:encoded: @Jon – Ahhh, you want to debate the use of a pie chart. Thank you for the insight. As I mentioned in the blog, this is a very, very basic example of something that could be done in a report. This blog has nothing to do with the theory of which visualizations work best for which situations. It’s to show people how to use Report Builder 3.0.

item.title: By: jonmcrawford
item.dc:creator: jonmcrawford
item.content:encoded:
erm, cool that they make it easy I guess, but it burns, it burns…http://www.perceptualedge.com/articles/08-21-07.pdf

At least you labeled the values directly in the chart, so you can compare the slices.
